comment.author: 9424625@N02
comment._content: Living in Telemark, my husband drove me to this hotel once, and we stopped and had coffee from a thermos in our car here.  It is still as interesting and a remarkable structure.  Next time we'll have to go inside.  It is also a very special drive to Dalen.  The parking lot is now where the grass is, though is luckily not large.

comment.author: 32962935@N00
comment._content: Too bad we can't add map locations to Library of Congress photoes. Anyway: This is here: maps.google.com/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&geo...

comment.author: 34301718@N06
comment._content: You can stay at this hotel today also, for map and contact information: rlb.no/hotel/info/40

comment.author: 34353497@N08
comment._content: I stayed there last summer. Fantastic! Almost everything is kept in the old style. Wonderful to find to a top hotel with no TV in the room! Hotel homepage: www.dalenhotel.no/ It was built in 1894, so it was probably brand new in this photo. The travelling photographer obviously was onboard a boat going from Skien up the Telemark Canal ending here in Dalen. From here, they went over the mountain to Hardangerfjorden, and crossed from Voss to Sognefjorden. This was apparently a popular trip among the wealthy at that time. It's mentioned in a book about the history of this hotel. Of course, it is still possible and recommendable to do today.
